Panhellenic adjective
(COUNTRY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
of or relating to Greece, especially the entire country of Greece and its people: The cries for panhellenic unity started to be heard in the 5th century BCE. Years of excavation uncovered part of the stadium in Nemea used for the ancient Panhellenic games.

Panhellenic adjective
(COLLEGE)
mainly US of or relating to fraternities and sororities (= social organizations for male or female students at an American or Canadian college), especially all of the ones that belong to a particular college or university: The Panhellenic Council took strict disciplinary action against the fraternity for violating its behaviour policies. The Panhellenic buildings were shared by all of the fraternities and sororities on campus.
More examplesFewer examplesThe President of the Panhellenic Council said that alcohol would not be allowed in sorority and fraternity houses.
